docs.lead_paragraph: Governor Cuomo has signed legislation allowing pregnant teen-agers to get prenatal care without their parents' consent. A Cuomo spokesman, Gary Fryer, said the Governor signed the bill because, under current law, ''a young girl could get an abortion without asking for her parents' permission, but she couldn't get medical care to help her have a healthy baby.'' The measure, which takes effect immediately, allows medical authorities to provide ''dental, health and hospital services relating to prenatal care'' to a pregnant minor.
